alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Nemaha (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 19 at 5:51PM CDT until April 19 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Nemaha County in northeastern Kansas... Eastern Marshall County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 550 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Beattie, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. A trained spotter reported half-dollar size hail 5 miles east of Marysville. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Marysville, Frankfort, Axtell, Beattie, Summerfield and Baileyville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern Kansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern Kansas.
